##
##qc32.exe -h ALL 

Press any key to continue . . . 
----------------------------------------------------------------------
QueryCopy for Oracle 11G (v0.3.1, beta, 2015/03/17 11:52:47) [32bit]
Copyright (c): 2014 Alex Buzunov, All rights reserved.
Agreement: Use this tool at your own risk. Author is not liable for any damages or losses related to the use of this software.
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Databases supported (3):
1. Oracle 11G
2. Oracle XE
3. Exadata

Data formats supported (1):
1. CSV

For detailed help use one of the options:

From Oracle 11G:

	To Oracle 11G          : qc32.exe -h ora11g2ora11g
	To Oracle XE           : qc32.exe -h ora11g2oraxe
	To Exadata             : qc32.exe -h ora11g2oraexa
	To CSV                 : qc32.exe -h ora11g2csv

To Oracle 11G:

	From Oracle XE         : qc32.exe -h oraxe2ora11g
	From Exadata           : qc32.exe -h oraexa2ora11g
	From CSV               : qc32.exe -h csv2ora11g


--USE CASES--

1. CSV_to_Oracle11G. 120 use cases.
2. Exadata_to_Oracle11G. 352 use cases.
3. Oracle11G_to_CSV. 145 use cases.
4. Oracle11G_to_Exadata. 352 use cases.
5. Oracle11G_to_Oracle11G. 352 use cases.
6. Oracle11G_to_OracleXE. 44 use cases.
7. OracleXE_to_Oracle11G. 64 use cases.


CSV_to_Oracle11G: 120 use case(s) available:

1. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Partition - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
2. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
3. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
4. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
5. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Table - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table table.
6. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
7. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
8. CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
9. CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Partition - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
10. CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
11. CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
12. CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
13. CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Table - Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table table.

81. CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition - Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
82. CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
83. CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3)

850. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Partition - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Partition table.
851. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Partition_TruncateTarget - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Partition TruncateTarget table.
852. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Subpartition - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Subpartition table.
853. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
854. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Table - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Table table.
855. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Table_NoClient - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Table NoClient table.
856. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Table_TruncateTarget - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Table TruncateTarget table.
857. ORA11G_Subpartition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORAEXA_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Copy Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
858. ORA11G_Subpartition_Limit10_to_ORAEXA_Partition - Copy only 10 rows from Oracle11G sub-partition into Exadata Partition table.

1146. ORA11G_ShardedPartition_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition - Break input sharded partition into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy only 10 rows from Oracle11G sharded partition into Oracle11G Partition table.

	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
1401. ORAXE_ShardedTable_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Break input table into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
1402. ORAXE_ShardedTable_to_ORA11G_Table - Break input table into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table table.
1403. ORAXE_ShardedTable_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient - Break input table into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
1404. ORAXE_ShardedTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget - Break input table into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
1405. ORAXE_ShardedTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Break input table into 3 logical shards (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run copy process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
1406. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Partition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition table.
1407. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
1408. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
1409. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
1410. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Table - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table table.
1411. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
1412. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
1413. ORAXE_Table_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
1414. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Partition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition table.
1415. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
1416. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
1417. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
1418. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Table - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table table.
1419. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
1420. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
1421. ORAXE_TimestampTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
1422. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Partition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition table.
1423. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
1424. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Subpartition - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
1425. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
1426. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Table - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table table.
1427. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
1428. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
1429. ORAXE_TimezoneTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient - Copy OracleXE table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.

--DETAILS--

-USE-CASE # 1
Use case name: CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 2
Use case name: CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 3
Use case name: CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^

  -N part_15_sp1 ^

-USE-CASE # 6
Use case name: CSV_DateFile_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."

  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."

  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 10
Use case name: CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 11
Use case name: CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 14
Use case name: CSV_DateFiles_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_dt.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 17
Use case name: CSV_DirsSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 19
Use case name: CSV_DirsSkip1_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 20
Use case name: CSV_DirsSkip1_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 22
Use case name: CSV_DirsSkip1_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 25
Use case name: CSV_Dirs_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 28
Use case name: CSV_Dirs_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Use case name: CSV_Dirs_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Table

  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."

  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."

  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."

  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^

Use case name: CSV_Dirs_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 37
Use case name: CSV_Dirs_to_ORA11G_Table
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 38
Use case name: CSV_Dirs_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 39
Use case name: CSV_Dirs_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 41
Use case name: CSV_FileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 100 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 100 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 47
Use case name: CSV_FileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget
Description:  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 100 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 49
Use case name: CSV_File_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 57
Use case name: CSV_ShardedDirSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 65
Use case name: CSV_ShardedDir_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 66
Use case name: CSV_ShardedDir_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Use case name: CSV_ShardedDir_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".

  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 74
Use case name: CSV_ShardedDir_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 75
Use case name: CSV_ShardedDir_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Description:  Read each CSV file from a directory "C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2".
	  Break input CSV files into logical partitions (shards) and run load 
	  process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3)
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -I[--input_dirs] is "Input CSV directory."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -I C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_1;C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\ora_data_dir_2 ^
  -y 50 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 81
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Use case name: CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 83
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.

  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."

  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."

-USE-CASE # 86
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFileSkip1_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Skip 1 rows and load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -k[--skip_rows] is "Header size. Number of rows to skip in input file."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -k 1 ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 89
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"
