  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 92
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load only 10 rows from CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 101
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_to_ORA11G_Table
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 102
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 103
Use case name: CSV_ShardedFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget
Description:  Break input CSV file into 3 logical partitions (-r[--num_of_shards] 3) 
	  and run load process on each shard in thread pool (-o[--pool_size] 3).
	  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 3 ^
  -r 3 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 10 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 105
Use case name: CSV_TimestampFile_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."

  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."

  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^

  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^

  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 111
Use case name: CSV_TimestampFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_ts.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 113
Use case name: CSV_TimezoneFile_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w csv2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_tz.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Use case name: CSV_TimezoneFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Load CSV file into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -i[--input_files] is "Input CSV file(s)."
  -y[--shard_size_kb] is "Shard size in KBytes (to partition file and to estimate number of lines in input CSV file)."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."

  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^

  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -i C:\Python27\data_migrator_1239\test\v101\data\oracle_shard_0_tz.data ^
  -y 1000 ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timezone_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 121
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 122
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 123
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 124
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Subpartition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Subpartition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 125
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Table
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Table table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 126
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."

  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."

  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."

  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^

  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^

  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^

-USE-CASE # 128
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_Email_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."

  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^

  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 129
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_JobName_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B FROM_ORAEXA_DateTable_JobName_TO_ORA11G_Partition ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 130
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_JobName_to_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Partition TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B FROM_ORAEXA_DateTable_JobName_TO_ORA11G_Partition_TruncateTarget ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^

  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B FROM_ORAEXA_DateTable_JobName_TO_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 137
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 144
Use case name: ORAEXA_DateTable_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient
Description:  Copy Exadata table into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Date_test_from ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Date_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 145
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 147
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 152
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_KeepSpoolFile_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget_NoClient
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 153
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy only 10 rows from Exadata partition into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."

  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 159
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_Limit10_to_ORA11G_Table_TruncateTarget
Description:  Copy only 10 rows from Exadata partition into Oracle11G Table TruncateTarget table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -l[--lame_duck] is "Limit rows (lame duck run)."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -l 10 ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 161
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_NoClient_to_ORA11G_Partition
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^

  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Partitioned_test_to ^
  -G part_15 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 163
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_NoClient_to_ORA11G_Subpartition
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Subpartition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."

  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^

  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 166
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_NoClient_to_ORA11G_Table_NoClient
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Table NoClient table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  echo y|C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^

  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."

  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."

  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."

  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 173
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_TruncateTarget_AskToTruncate_to_ORA11G_Table
Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Table table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -E[--ask_to_truncate] is "Ask to truncate."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -E 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."

  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."

Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -E 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d '(DESCRIPTION=(ADDRESS=(PROTOCOL=TCP)(HOST=localhost)(PORT=1521))(CONNECT_DATA=(SERVER=DEDICATED)(SERVICE_NAME=orcl)))' ^
  -a SCOTT.Timestamp_test_to ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

Description:  Copy Exadata partition into Oracle11G Partition table.
Arguments:
  -w[--copy_vector] is "Data copy direction."
  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -V[--validate] is "Check if source and target objects exist."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."

  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."

  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -G[--to_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."

  -K 1 ^
  -V 1 ^

  -P part_15 ^

  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^

  -G part_15 ^

  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."
  -V[--validate] is "Check if source and target objects exist."
  -U[--truncate_target] is "Truncate target table/partition/subpartition."
  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."
  -u[--to_user] is "Target Oracle 11G db user."
  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."
  -a[--to_table] is "To Oracle table."
  -N[--to_sub_partition] is "To Oracle table."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
  -Z[--target_client_home] is "Path to Oracle 11G client home bin dir."	
Example: 
  python -c "print 'y\ny'" |C:\Python27\qc_dist_32\20150317_115247\qc32\qc32.exe ^
  -w oraexa2ora11g ^
  -o 1 ^
  -r 1 ^
  -t "|" ^
  -K 1 ^
  -V 1 ^
  -U 1 ^
  -M C:\Temp\qc_log ^
  -F C:\tmp\TEST_default_spool ^
  -B qc_job ^
  -Y 20150317_115247_901000 ^
  -c SCOTT.Partitioned_test_from ^
  -P part_15 ^
  -j SCOTT ^
  -x tiger2 ^
  -b orcl ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN" ^
  -u SCOTT ^
  -p tiger2 ^
  -d orcl ^
  -a SCOTT.Sub_Partitioned_test_to ^
  -N part_15_sp1 ^
  -e "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS" ^
  -m "YYYY-MM-DD HH24.MI.SS.FF2" ^
  -O "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MI:SS.FF2 TZH:TZM" ^
  -Z "C:\app\alex_buz\product\11.2.0\dbhome_2\BIN"

-USE-CASE # 181
Use case name: ORAEXA_Partition_Validate_to_ORA11G_Table

Arguments:

  -o[--pool_size] is "Pool size."
  -r[--num_of_shards] is "Number of shards."
  -t[--field_term] is "Field terminator."
  -K[--keep_data_file] is "Keep data dump."

  -M[--log_dir] is "Log destination."
  -F[--default_spool_dir] is "Default data dump dir (default_spool_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -B[--job_name] is "Job name (log_dir/job_name)."
  -Y[--time_stamp] is "Timestamp (log_dir/job_name/timestamp)."
  -c[--from_table] is "From table."
  -P[--from_partition] is "From partition."
  -j[--from_user] is "Exadata source user."
  -x[--from_passwd] is "Exadata source user password."
  -b[--from_db_name] is "Exadata source database."
  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for source."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for source."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for source."
  -z[--source_client_home] is "Path to Exadata client home."

  -p[--to_passwd] is "Oracle 11G user password."
  -d[--to_db_name] is "Oracle 11G database."

  -e[--nls_date_format] is "nls_date_format for target."
  -m[--nls_timestamp_format] is "nls_timestamp_format for target."
  -O[--nls_timestamp_tz_format] is "nls_timestamp_tz_format for target."
